intro: Orchis incarnata subsp. cruenta, commonly known as the scarlet twayblade, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with a single, showy purple or red flower. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows. It has a short, erect stem with a single leaf and produces a distinctive, spurred orchid flower. The species is pollinated by bees and is considered an indicator of healthy, undisturbed ecosystems.
